content: सामन् {%<ab>n.</ab>%} [सो-मनिन् <ls>Uṇ. 4. 152</ls>] {@--1@} Appeasing, calming, comforting, soothing. {@--2@} Conciliation, pacific measures, negotiation, (the first of the four {%upāyas%} or expedients to be used by a king against an enemy); सामदंडौ प्रशंसंति नित्यं राष्ट्राभिवृद्धये <ls>Ms. 7. 109.</ls> {@--3@} Conciliatory or mild means, pacific or conciliatory conduct, gentle words; <ls>Pt. 4. 26</ls>, <ls n="Pt. 4.">48.</ls> {@--4@} Mildness, gentleness. {@--5@} A metrical hymn or song of praise; सप्तसामोपगीतं त्वां <ls>R. 10. 21</ls>, <ls>Bg. 10. 35.</ls> {@--6@} A verse or text of the Sāmaveda. {@--7@} The Sāmaveda itself (said to have been produced from the sun; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Ms. 1. 23</ls>).
